bio: Ralph Waldo Emerson was an American philosopher, essayist, and poet. He was born in 1847 in Ohio, and died in 1921 in New York City. Emerson is best known for his essay "The Civil War," which he wrote in 1862. The essay is a call for peace and a critique of the war. Emerson's other famous works include "The Law of Identity," "The Idea of Social Justice," and "On Liberty."
